column4: I really don't want to have to start compiling my kernel all the time to get the full 4GB of memory. does anyone know of a desktop kernel package with PAE enabled?
what is PAE?
some kernel option that is apparently going to help me actually use all of my memory
how much mem do you have bro
just 4GB, but it's limited to 3.2GB on 32-bit, it seems
do you have 32bit?
yes
what processor do you have?
pentium core 2 quad
why not use 64bit version?
my pentium is not 64-bit
same processor as me.  Its quad core you said
problem solved
just load an entire new ISO of Ubuntu?
or you could play with PAE for fun
is it possible to upgrade a 32-bit ubuntu to 64-bit? or will I have to install fresh ?
you have istall fresh
well I guess I've barely installed anything yet so it's not a big problem
no, it shows 3.2GB just the same
I have 3 and only notices 2.9G
Linux has had 64 bit and been developing for it for years,  i have no issues with mine
good
